text: 1. CALL TO ORDER/FLAG SALUTE/EISENHOWER ELEMENTARY SCHOOL PRESENTATION
2. APPROVAL OF MINUTES
Approval of minutes of the Regular Meetings of April 9, 2013 and April 30, 2013
3. COMMUNICATION – EMPLOYEE ORGANIZATIONS
4. PUBLIC COMMENTS
The public may address the Board on any agenda item and any item not on the agenda.  The Board
president will only call on those who have filled out comment cards before the meeting, and each speaker
will be allotted three (3) minutes.  The Board will not respond or take action on any non-agenda item
comments at this time, although the item may be agendized at a later date (Ed. Code 35145.5).  The
comments shall be made from the podium.  In accordance with Government Code 54954.2 – No action or
discussion shall be undertaken on any item not appearing on the posted agenda.  The Board shall limit the
total time to 30 minutes.
5. PUBLIC HEARING
5.1  The Board of Education will hold a Public Hearing regarding the Adoption of Resolution No.
12-13-21 – Approval of the Complete or Partial Closure of Tier III Categorical Programs in the
District’s Unrestricted General Fund in Fiscal Year 2013-14
The Public Hearing was opened at:  __________________________
The Public Hearing was closed at:    __________________________
6. RECOGNITION
6.1  Recognition of Classified Employee of the Month – May 2013
Lillian Wong/Technology Media Clerk/West Valley Elementary School
Board Meeting Agenda May 14, 2013 Page 2
6.2  Adoption of Resolution No. 12-13-22 – Recognition of Classified School Employee Week,
6.3  Adoption of Resolution No. 12-13-23 – Recognition of Day of the Teacher, May 8, 2013
7. PRESENTATION
7.1  Certificates of Recognition for the 2013-14 School Site Teachers of the Year and
Announcement of District’s Teacher of the Year and reconvene following the reception
Recess:  The Regular Meeting will recess to a reception in honor of Cupertino Union School
District’s Teacher of the Year and reconvene following the reception.
8. CONSENT ITEMS
Consent items are considered to be routine by the Board of Education and will be enacted in one
motion.  If discussion of any of the items is required, they may be removed from Consent and
considered separately.
8.1  Ratification of April 2013 Personnel report
8.2  Ratification of April 2013 Warrant List
8.3  Contract Award to Smith & Sons Electrical Contractors, Inc. in the Amount of $295,000 for
Procurement and Installation of New Site Lighting Fixtures at the DeVargas, Dilworth, Lincoln,
McAuliffe, Meyerholz and Regnart Elementary School Campuses (Bid No. 13-B11-24)
8.4  Contract Award to Guerra Construction Group for the Installation of Six Modular Classroom
Buildings at Faria Elementary (1), Muir Elementary (2), Kennedy Middle School (2) and Miller
Middle School (1)
8.5  Contract Award to R. G., Custom Painting, Inc. for Painting Exterior Trim at Luther School
8.6  Contract Award to IT Management Corp. in the Amount of $1,614,797 for the District-wide
Network Infrastructure Upgrade
8.7  Approval of CIS, Inc., Keith Brown Inspections, and Dan Butler & Company Inspection
Services as Qualified Inspectors-Of-Record for Assignment to Future Measure H Bond
Projects
8.8  Adoption of Resolution No. 12-13-21 – Approval of the Complete or Partial Closure of Tier III
Categorical Programs in the District’s Unrestricted General Fund in Fiscal Year 2013-14
8.9  Contract Award to Meehleis Modular Buildings, Inc. in the Amount of $17,084,500 for Design
and Construction of a New Two-Story Classroom Building at Cupertino Middle School and a
New Music Building and New Two-Story Classroom Building at Lawson Middle School
9. SUPERINTENDENT’S REPORT
10. ACTION ITEMS
10.1  Approval – Request to Submit to the California Commission of Teacher Credentialing of a
Provisional Internship Permit (PIP) in Visual Impairment Request for Timothy McClellan
11.  CLOSED SESSION
By law, closed sessions are not open to the public.  Anyone wishing to address the Board of
Education on closed session matters may do so during Agenda Item 4 – Public Comments.
11.1 Conference with Labor Negotiator
District Representative Nancy Johnson
Employee Associations:  Cupertino Education Association (CEA), California School
Employees Association (CSEA), Chapter 13, Service Employees International Union (SEIU),
Local 521
11.2 Certificated/Classified Employee Discipline/Dismissal/Release
Board Meeting Agenda May 14, 2013 Page 3
12. REPORT FROM CLOSED SESSION
13. ADJOURNMENT
